p: A total of 13 compounds from the lemongrass essential oil were identified, which accounted for 95.98% of its total composition (Table 2). The primary compounds of the lemongrass oil were neral (31.5%), citral (26.1%), nonan-4-ol (6.54%), camphene (5.19%), 6-metil-hept-5-en-2-one (4.36%), citronelal (3.83%), β-caryophyllene (3.26%), citronelol (2.95%), caryophyllene oxide (2.63%), γ-muurolene (2.46%), limonene (2.32%), geranyl acetate (2.27%), and geranial (2.15%).
